name: IKEA Meatballs
keywords: IKEA Meatballs, Swedish Meatballs, Button Mushrooms, Brown Onion, Red Capsicum, Red Wine Sauce, Chicken Stock, Garlic Butter, Thyme, Main Course, Swedish Cuisine, Fried Meatballs, Simmered Sauce, One Pan Meal, Easy Recipe, Comfort Food, Dinner Idea, Homemade, Meatball Recipe, Mushroom Sauce, Savory, Rich Sauce, Served with Rice
description: A flavorful take on IKEA meatballs, pan-fried and then simmered in a rich red wine and chicken stock sauce featuring button mushrooms, onions, red capsicum, garlic, and thyme.

recipeInstructions.text: In your biggest pan start by frying the meatballs in the butter until cooked through and browned. Don't fry over too high of a heat or you'll burn the butter.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry meatballs

recipeInstructions.text: While the meatballs fry, finely dice your onion and cut the mushrooms and capsicum into small chunks. Once the meatballs are fried, add the onion in and cook for about 5-10 minutes until softened.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry Onions

recipeInstructions.text: Once onions are softened, add the mushrooms and capsicums and cooked until the mushrooms are shrunk significantly. Add the rest of the ingredients and simmer until the sauce is rich and thick. About 40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer

recipeInstructions.text: Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over rice with freshly diced chilis.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: My favorite way to use IKEA meatballs. Not really traditional but it packs huge flavor. Also really good with mashed potato or if you're into it great with pasta too.
